incidents.name: Errors when deploying new versions of Retool apps with source control

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating "Unable to Deploy" errors when pushing new versions of Retool apps via source control.

components.name: Source Control
components.description: Source Control allows organizations to manage changes using source control management providers, such as GitHub, GitLab, AWS CodeCommit, Bitbucket, and Azure Repos. Provider outages can cause temporary Retool source control outages.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've identified an anomalous traffic pattern causing high response times, and our latency has recovered.
We're investigating high response times for some backend requests.

incidents.name: Issues running queries that used SSH tunnelling

incident_updates.body: 25% of resources that used SSH Tunneling were failing between 21:00 UTC and 22:45 UTC.
The configuration change has been rolled back and systems are stable. Incident is resolved at this time.
A configuration issue caused a networking outage that impacted critical retool components from 3:41 PST to 4:00 PST. Systems have recovered and we are actively monitoring.

components.name: Infrastructure
components.description: Retool infrastructure runs on top of AWS. AWS outages can cause temporary Retool outages as well.

components.name: License server
components.description: Server for self-hosted Retool instance to validate their licenses

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Requested domains will be provisioned after maintenance is complete

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring.
We are currently investigating the issue
This incident has been resolved.
Our upstream provider is recovering and emails are successfully sending again.
Our upstream email provider is having a major outage which impacts all outgoing Retool email (invites, password resets, etc...). We are closely monitoring progress.
This incident has been resolved.

We have received reports of Retool cloud accounts experiencing slow load times through the app from EU based users. We have confirmed all Retool infrastructure is operating normally, and have seen that using a US VPN currently seems the best way to work around such networking issues.

incidents.name: Apps with "expand content to fit" not loading

incident_updates.body: Between 3:01pm PDT and 3:50pm PDT, Retool apps with the "expand content to fit" property were unable to load.

incidents.name: Issues with Spaces and Custom Domains provisioning

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Some customers might experience issues with provisioning new Spaces or Custom Domains. We're investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.

Some Retool-managed Temporal namespaces are experiencing degraded service levels due to an ongoing incident with our third-party vendor, Temporal.io. A small number of self-hosted customers will have their workflow executions stalled until the incident is resolved.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

This incident has been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience caused. This was due to an infrastructure code change that was not well-validated and we will be putting systems in place to ensure this classification of issue cannot reach our production environment without proper validation.
Resource queries should be fully operational as of ~17:42 UTC. We will continue monitor closely to be sure there are no further issues.
We have identified and implemented a fix. We are monitoring error rates as they return to normal.
We are investigating abnormally high error rates when running resource queries.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for the root cause of the issue, in the meantime the issue has been mitigated and all services are operational.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.

We are currently not observing the previously reported issue. Our team is actively monitoring the system to ensure ongoing stability and to promptly address any reoccurrences. We appreciate your understanding and will provide further updates as necessary.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.
We rolled back cloud and the issue has been resolved.

We are currently investigating an issue causing freezing/unresponsiveness on app load. This seems to be affecting users on Chrome with hardware acceleration. As a workaround for the time being, try using another browser or disabling 'hardware acceleration' in Chrome.
This incident has been resolved
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring performance
We are investigating increased latency and errors

components.name: Infrastructure
components.description: Retool infrastructure runs on top of AWS. AWS outages can cause temporary Retool outages as well.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The new database instance is up and we are monitoring. Thank you for bearing with us through this incident, please contact us through support if continue to see any issues.
We are still monitoring the database recreation.
We are still monitoring the database recreation.
We are still monitoring the database recreation.

We are in the process of restoring a database backup from the point at which this particular instance went down. Unfortunately due to the size of the database we cannot give an ETA when it will be back up yet. We apologize for the inconvenience and will have an update in 3 hours or less.
We are continuing to investigate this issue and will provide updates as soon as we have them.
We have identified this to be an upstream issue with our database vendor (AWS) and we are working with them to resolve.
We are currently investigating reports of a subset of Cloud orgs no longer able to access a specific instance of the managed_db starter postgres resource.

components.name: Infrastructure
components.description: Retool infrastructure runs on top of AWS. AWS outages can cause temporary Retool outages as well.

incidents.name: Query errors for script clients and some public apps

incident_updates.body: The fix has been deployed and resolution confirmed.

We have identified an issue causing non-browser clients (i.e. custom scripts) to be unable to make resource queries as well as a small percentage of public apps to fail to load. We have identified the cause and will deploy a fix shortly.

incidents.name: Elevated query latency and error rates

incident_updates.body:
Customers may have experienced elevated rates of 502's and significantly higher query latency on a subset of queries for a small period of time (12:50PM -> 2PM PST)

We've identified the cause and are continuing to monitor while rolling out a longer-term fix.

incidents.name: Chunk loading errors on self-hosted Retool instances

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Self-hosted deployments that are configured to automatically pull new Docker images may experience frontend chunk loading issues when some but not all containers are started / restarted. To fix these issues, please restart the remaining containers in the deployment.
Users on self-hosted Retool instances might experience interruptions on sending user invites
This incident has been resolved.

We have addressed an issue with our data cache and our monitors have returned to normal. Workflows runs were delayed and possibly failed if there were multiple scheduled runs of the same workflow between ~13:30 UTC and ~14:30 UTC.
We are investigating an issue with elevated error rates on our backend API, possibly data cache related.

components.name: Infrastructure

incidents.name: AWS domains resolving as private IP addresses

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have applied a fix and are monitoring an issue where DNS resolution for AWS subdomains of *.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com were incorrectly resolving to private IP addresses.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
We have applied a fix and are monitoring an issue where DNS resolution for some AWS (sub)domains were incorrectly resolving to private IP addresses.
